授業目的:
1. To acquire well-structured research and analysis skills on current global financial markets and in the Asian context;
2. To keep abreast of global developments and adapt to changing financial market trends;
3. To develop cross-cultural awareness and understand the importance of future innovative trends in the Asian financial services industry.
到達目標:
ILO 1: To apply traditional and new analysis of the financial market to the East Asian economies and the region as a whole;
ILO 2: To familiarize students with the use of Asian financial market, investment, capital funding, and economic development data for Asian businesses and the region as a whole;
ILO 3: To familiarize students with the institutional features of various Asian countries and develop a global and regional outlook.

By the end of this course, students will be able to define and evaluate Asian financial markets, understand the evolution of market trends, identify the benefits of global strategy for your company, and quantify economic and financial market trends in major Asian financial centers.
特記事項: 【合併】Asian Financial Market（経営戦略研究科）/Asian Financial Market（経営戦略研究科）
授業の概要・背景: In this course, students will learn how global financial markets work, the Asian financial systems and institution issues that are related to many Asian countries, and how that information assists the industry’s senior management level as Director, CEO, and CFO in making optimal financing and risk management decisions in corporate investments. It also provides students with global perspectives on Asian financial market developments and business practices in Asia.
授業方法:
In-class lecturing and discussions;
Work on the suggested reading materials.

Some additional course resources distributed in class are optional and are not required for this course. However, reading the recommended textbook as suggested is highly appreciated:

Mishkin, Frederic S., and Eakins G. Stanley. Financial Markets and Institutions, 9th Edition, Global Edition. Boston, MA: Pearson, 2018.
